data.content:
Nautilus (Warden Nautilus)

Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: March 5, 2015

Warden Nautilus is a skin for the champion Nautilus in the popular online game League of Legends. This skin was released on March 5, 2015, and is available for purchase in the in-game store for 1350 RP. With its unique design and thematic elements, Warden Nautilus offers players a fresh and exciting visual experience.

The Warden Nautilus skin transforms the deep-sea diver into a formidable guardian of justice. Clad in heavy armor and wielding a massive anchor, Nautilus takes on the role of a warden, patrolling the depths of the ocean to ensure order and protect the innocent. This skin features a distinct color palette of blues and silvers, giving Nautilus a regal and authoritative appearance.

One of the standout features of Warden Nautilus is the intricate detail in his armor. The heavy plates and rivets create a sense of strength and durability, emphasizing Nautilus' role as a protector. The anchor he wields is also given a new look, with glowing blue energy emanating from its core. This adds a touch of mystique and power to his attacks, making them even more impactful.

In addition to the visual changes, Warden Nautilus also has unique sound effects. His abilities and attacks are accompanied by deep, resonating sounds that further enhance the theme of a powerful guardian. The sound of his anchor crashing down or his shield activating adds an extra layer of immersion to the gameplay experience.

Now, let's delve into the story of Nautilus and how he came to be the fearsome warden of the depths. Nautilus was once a sailor who met a tragic fate. He was aboard a ship that sailed too close to the mysterious and treacherous Black Mist, a supernatural phenomenon that corrupts and consumes everything in its path. The ship was swallowed by the mist, and Nautilus was dragged down into the depths.

But instead of meeting his end, Nautilus was transformed. The dark magic of the Black Mist fused with his body, turning him into a hulking behemoth. He emerged from the depths as a twisted and vengeful creature, seeking retribution against those who had wronged him. With his newfound strength and the power of the ocean at his command, Nautilus became a force to be reckoned with.

In the game, Nautilus is a tanky support champion known for his crowd control abilities and durability. His passive ability, Staggering Blow, allows him to root enemies with his basic attacks, making him a formidable presence in team fights. His Q ability, Dredge Line, allows him to hook onto enemies and pull himself towards them, initiating fights or catching out-of-position opponents.

Nautilus' Warden skin perfectly complements his playstyle and lore. As a warden, he embodies the role of a protector and enforcer of justice. His imposing presence and ability to lock down enemies make him a valuable asset to any team. With the Warden Nautilus skin, players can fully embrace the thematic elements of this champion and feel the weight of their anchor as they bring justice to the Rift.

On this page, you can find information and videos showcasing all the appearances of Nautilus, including the Warden Nautilus skin. Whether you're a fan of his classic look or want to explore the different skins available, this page is your go-to resource for all things Nautilus.

Nautilus (Conqueror Nautilus)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: August 6, 2020

Nautilus, the Titan of the Depths, has always been a formidable force on the Rift. With his massive anchor and impenetrable armor, he strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies. And now, with the release of the Conqueror Nautilus skin, he becomes an even more imposing figure on the battlefield.

Conqueror Nautilus is a skin that embodies the spirit of a true warrior. Clad in golden armor adorned with intricate engravings, Nautilus exudes power and authority. His anchor, once a simple tool for the depths, has been transformed into a weapon of war, with sharp spikes and a menacing aura. With each swing, it leaves a trail of golden energy, symbolizing the strength and determination of its wielder.

The attention to detail in this skin is truly remarkable. From the ornate patterns on his armor to the glowing runes etched into his anchor, every aspect of Conqueror Nautilus has been carefully crafted to create a visually stunning and thematically cohesive skin. The golden color palette adds a touch of regality to his appearance, making him stand out on the battlefield.

But Conqueror Nautilus is not just about looks. The skin also features new visual and sound effects that enhance the overall experience. When Nautilus activates his abilities, they are accompanied by a satisfying sound and a burst of golden energy. The impact of his anchor hitting an enemy is now even more impactful, leaving no doubt about the power behind each strike.

Nautilus himself is a champion with a rich lore and a unique playstyle. He was once a sailor who met a tragic fate, dragged down into the depths of the ocean by a mysterious anchor. But instead of perishing, he was transformed into a hulking behemoth, forever bound to the depths. Now, he roams the seas, seeking redemption and punishing those who would disturb the peace of the ocean.

In the game, Nautilus is primarily played as a tanky support or a durable top laner. His kit revolves around crowd control and disruption, making him a valuable asset in team fights. His Q ability, Dredge Line, allows him to hook onto enemies and pull himself towards them, setting up opportunities for his team to engage. His W ability, Titan's Wrath, grants him a shield and bonus damage, making him even more resilient in battle. And his ultimate, Depth Charge, sends out a shockwave that knocks up enemies in its path, effectively disrupting the enemy team and allowing his allies to follow up with their own abilities.

While Nautilus excels at engaging and locking down enemies, he does have some weaknesses. His lack of mobility makes him vulnerable to champions with high mobility or long-range poke. Additionally, his abilities have long cooldowns, so timing and decision-making are crucial when playing him. However, with proper positioning and coordination with his team, Nautilus can be a force to be reckoned with.

If you're interested in learning more about Nautilus and his various appearances in the game, you can find information and videos on the League of Legends website. Whether you prefer the regal Conqueror Nautilus or one of his other skins, there's no denying the impact this champion can have on the battlefield.

Nautilus: The Titan of the Depths

Release Date: February 14, 2012

Nautilus, the Titan of the Depths, is a formidable champion in the popular online game League of Legends. With his imposing presence and powerful abilities, Nautilus has become a favorite pick for players who enjoy playing tanky champions with crowd control capabilities. In this article, we will delve into Nautilus' story, his strengths and weaknesses, his background in the game, and his place in the League of Legends universe.

The Story of Nautilus

Nautilus was once a sailor who braved the treacherous seas of Runeterra. However, his life took a tragic turn when he encountered a mysterious and malevolent force known as the Black Mist. The Black Mist consumed Nautilus' ship, leaving him to a watery grave. But instead of finding peace in death, Nautilus was transformed into a hulking behemoth, forever bound to the depths of the ocean.

Now, Nautilus roams the ocean floor, seeking vengeance against the creatures of the Black Mist and anyone who dares to disturb the tranquility of the sea. With his massive anchor and impenetrable armor, he strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies, dragging them down into the abyss with him.

Strengths and Weaknesses

Nautilus is a tanky champion with exceptional crowd control abilities, making him a formidable force in team fights. His passive ability, Staggering Blow, allows him to root enemies with his basic attacks, providing valuable crowd control and setting up kills for his team. Additionally, his Q ability, Dredge Line, allows him to hook onto enemies from a distance, pulling himself towards them and stunning them upon arrival.

Furthermore, Nautilus' W ability, Titan's Wrath, grants him a shield that absorbs damage and enhances his basic attacks with bonus damage. This ability not only increases his survivability but also allows him to deal significant damage to his opponents. His E ability, Riptide, unleashes a wave of water around him, damaging and slowing enemies caught in its path. This ability is particularly useful for wave clear and zoning enemies in team fights.

Nautilus' ultimate ability, Depth Charge, is a game-changer. He launches a massive anchor towards a target location, damaging and knocking up all enemies in its path. This ability can be used to initiate team fights, catch out-of-position enemies, or peel for his carries. The sheer impact and disruption caused by Depth Charge can turn the tide of battle in favor of Nautilus' team.

Despite his strengths, Nautilus does have some weaknesses. His lack of mobility makes him vulnerable to champions with high mobility or long-range poke. Additionally, his abilities have relatively high cooldowns, making him susceptible to being kited or burst down if he misses his crucial crowd control abilities. Proper positioning and timing are essential for Nautilus players to maximize his effectiveness in fights.

Nautilus in the Game

Nautilus is primarily played as a support or a tank in the game. His crowd control abilities and tankiness make him an excellent choice for protecting his team's carries and initiating team fights. In the bot lane, Nautilus can lock down enemy champions, allowing his ADC to deal damage safely. His ability to engage and peel for his team makes him a valuable asset in the late game when team fights become crucial for securing objectives and winning the game.

Nautilus can also be played in the top lane as a tanky bruiser. With his high base damage and crowd control, he can bully opponents and disrupt the enemy team's backline in team fights. His ability to soak up damage and initiate fights makes him a reliable frontliner for his team.

Furthermore, Nautilus' lore and character design have made him a fan-favorite among players. His imposing appearance and tragic backstory have captured the imaginations of many. Players who resonate with Nautilus' story and playstyle often find themselves drawn to his character, making him a popular choice in the game.

On the website developed for the League of Legends game, you can access information and videos of all skins available for Nautilus. Each skin offers a unique visual and thematic experience, allowing players to customize their champion to their liking. Whether it's the classic Abyssal Nautilus, the fearsome AstroNautilus, or the majestic Worldbreaker Nautilus, players can explore and appreciate the various skins available for this iconic champion.

In conclusion, Nautilus is a powerful and captivating champion in the League of Legends universe. With his tragic backstory, imposing presence, and crowd control abilities, he has become a beloved pick for players who enjoy playing tanky champions with a focus on disruption and protection. Whether played as a support or a top laner, Nautilus' impact in team fights and his ability to control the battlefield make him a force to be reckoned with. So, dive into the depths with Nautilus and experience the thrill of commanding the tides of battle!

Nautilus (AstroNautilus)

Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: November 29, 2012

Nautilus, the Titan of the Depths, has always been a formidable force in the League of Legends. With his massive anchor and impenetrable armor, he strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies. However, there is one skin that takes his intimidating presence to a whole new level - AstroNautilus. Released on November 29, 2012, this skin transforms Nautilus into a cosmic entity, ready to conquer the depths of space.

AstroNautilus is a legendary skin, priced at 1350 RP. It offers a complete visual overhaul for Nautilus, giving him a futuristic and otherworldly appearance. From his sleek, metallic armor to the glowing blue lights that emanate from his body, every detail of this skin exudes a sense of cosmic power. Nautilus's anchor is transformed into a celestial object, resembling a swirling galaxy, while his abilities are accompanied by stunning visual effects that match the theme perfectly.

The AstroNautilus skin not only changes Nautilus's appearance but also adds new voice lines and sound effects. When playing with this skin, Nautilus's voice takes on an echoey, ethereal quality, further enhancing the cosmic theme. The sound effects for his abilities are also modified, creating a more immersive experience for players.

Nautilus, the champion behind the AstroNautilus skin, has a rich lore within the world of League of Legends. He was once a sailor who met a tragic fate at sea, only to be resurrected as a hulking behemoth by the mysterious power of the depths. Now, he roams the ocean depths, seeking redemption and punishing those who would disturb the balance of the sea.

In the game, Nautilus is classified as a tank and a support champion. His kit revolves around crowd control and disruption, making him a valuable asset in team fights. His passive ability, Staggering Blow, allows him to root enemies with his basic attacks, while his Q ability, Dredge Line, allows him to hook onto enemies from a distance and pull himself towards them. His W ability, Titan's Wrath, grants him a shield and enhances his basic attacks with bonus damage. Nautilus's E ability, Riptide, creates a wave that damages and slows enemies in a large area, while his ultimate ability, Depth Charge, sends out a massive shockwave that knocks up and damages all enemies in its path.

Nautilus's strengths lie in his ability to initiate team fights and lock down high-priority targets. With his crowd control abilities, he can single-handedly disrupt the enemy team's positioning and create opportunities for his allies to follow up. His tankiness also allows him to soak up damage and protect his team, making him an excellent frontline champion.

However, Nautilus does have some weaknesses. His lack of mobility makes him vulnerable to champions with high mobility or long-range poke. Additionally, his abilities have relatively long cooldowns, so mistiming or wasting them can leave him vulnerable and less effective in fights. Nautilus also heavily relies on his team to follow up on his engages, so coordination and communication are key when playing him.

Nautilus has been a staple pick in professional play for many years. His ability to engage and lock down key targets has made him a favorite among support players. In the top lane, he can also be a formidable tank, capable of soaking up damage and disrupting the enemy team's backline. His versatility and reliability have made him a popular choice in both competitive and casual play.

If you want to learn more about Nautilus and his various appearances in the League of Legends, you can find information and videos on this page. Whether it's the intimidating AstroNautilus skin or his other captivating costumes, Nautilus is a champion that demands respect and strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies.

Nautilus (Abyssal Nautilus)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: November 29, 2011

Nautilus, the Titan of the Depths, is a fearsome champion in the popular online game League of Legends. With his massive anchor and impenetrable armor, he roams the depths of the ocean, seeking justice and protecting the innocent. One of his most iconic skins is the

which transforms him into a terrifying creature from the darkest depths of the sea.

Abyssal Nautilus is a 1350 RP skin that was released on November 29, 2011. It offers players a unique and menacing look for Nautilus, with a dark color scheme and eerie effects that perfectly capture the essence of the abyss. This skin is a favorite among Nautilus enthusiasts, as it adds an extra layer of intimidation to an already formidable champion.

The Abyssal Nautilus skin features a complete visual overhaul for the champion. Nautilus himself is transformed into a terrifying creature, with glowing blue eyes and a menacing presence. His armor is adorned with intricate details, resembling the scales of a deep-sea monster. The anchor he wields is also given a dark makeover, with haunting blue energy emanating from its core.

One of the standout features of the Abyssal Nautilus skin is the unique particle effects it brings to the champion's abilities. When Nautilus uses his Dredge Line ability, a trail of dark energy follows the anchor as it travels towards its target. The Riptide ability creates a swirling vortex of water, tinged with an otherworldly blue glow. And when Nautilus activates his ultimate ability, Depth Charge, a massive wave of dark energy crashes down on his enemies, leaving them in awe of his power.

Nautilus, the champion behind the Abyssal Nautilus skin, has a rich lore and history within the League of Legends universe. He was once a sailor who met a tragic fate at the hands of a mysterious sea monster. Dragged down to the depths of the ocean, Nautilus was transformed into a hulking behemoth, forever bound to the sea. Now, he seeks to bring justice to the world, using his immense strength and unwavering determination to protect the innocent.

In the game, Nautilus is known for his tankiness and crowd control abilities. With his massive anchor and durable armor, he excels at soaking up damage and disrupting the enemy team. His abilities allow him to lock down high-priority targets, making him a valuable asset in team fights. However, Nautilus lacks mobility and can be easily kited by champions with high mobility or crowd control abilities of their own.

Nautilus has found his place in the game as a reliable tank and initiator. His ability to engage fights and lock down key targets makes him a popular pick in competitive play. His crowd control abilities can turn the tide of a team fight, allowing his teammates to follow up and secure kills. Nautilus is often seen in the support role, where his ability to protect his ADC and set up kills is highly valued.

On the page dedicated to Abyssal Nautilus, players can find detailed information about the skin, including its release date and RP cost. They can also watch videos showcasing the skin's visual effects and animations. Additionally, players can explore other skins available for Nautilus and learn more about his lore and gameplay mechanics.

Whether you're a fan of Nautilus or simply appreciate the dark and menacing aesthetic of the Abyssal Nautilus skin, this page is a valuable resource for all things related to this fearsome champion. Dive into the depths and unleash the power of the abyss with Abyssal Nautilus!

Nautilus (Subterranean Nautilus)

RP Cost: 975 RP

Release Date: November 29, 2011

Nautilus, the Titan of the Depths, is a fearsome champion in the popular online game League of Legends. With his massive anchor and imposing presence, Nautilus strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies. One of his most iconic skins is the

skin, which transforms him into a formidable force from the depths of the ocean.

The

skin was released on November 29, 2011, and is available for purchase in the in-game store for 975 RP. This skin gives Nautilus a unique and menacing appearance, with his armor and anchor taking on a dark and rugged look. The skin also features new visual effects and animations, adding to the overall immersion and excitement of playing as Nautilus.

When Nautilus dons the

skin, he becomes an even more formidable force on the battlefield. His imposing presence is enhanced by the skin's dark color palette and intricate details. The armor on his body and anchor is adorned with spikes and jagged edges, giving him a more menacing and intimidating look. The anchor itself is transformed into a massive, spiked weapon, ready to crush anyone who dares to stand in Nautilus' way.

The visual effects of the

skin are also worth mentioning. When Nautilus uses his abilities, such as his Dredge Line or Depth Charge, the visual effects are enhanced to match the theme of the skin. The water effects are more pronounced, and the impact of his abilities feels more powerful and impactful. These visual enhancements add an extra layer of immersion and excitement to the gameplay experience.

Nautilus, the champion behind the

skin, has a rich and intriguing backstory. Once a sailor, Nautilus met a tragic fate when he encountered a mysterious and powerful creature from the depths of the ocean. The creature dragged him down into the abyss, where he was left to die. However, instead of perishing, Nautilus was transformed into a hulking behemoth, forever bound to the ocean's depths.

Now, Nautilus roams the ocean floor, seeking vengeance against the creature that took everything from him. With his massive anchor and powerful abilities, he strikes fear into the hearts of all who dare to challenge him. Nautilus is known for his incredible durability and crowd control abilities, making him a formidable tank and initiator in team fights.

One of Nautilus' strengths lies in his ability to engage and lock down enemies with his crowd control. His Dredge Line ability allows him to hook onto enemies from a distance, pulling himself towards them and stunning them upon arrival. This ability is a powerful initiation tool, allowing Nautilus to start team fights and catch out-of-position enemies.

Another strength of Nautilus is his durability. With his massive size and thick armor, Nautilus can soak up a tremendous amount of damage. His Titan's Wrath ability grants him a shield that absorbs damage, making him even more difficult to take down. Nautilus' durability makes him an excellent frontline tank, capable of soaking up damage for his team and protecting his carries.

However, Nautilus does have some weaknesses that players should be aware of. One of his main weaknesses is his lack of mobility. Nautilus is a slow-moving champion, and once he commits to a fight, it can be difficult for him to disengage. This makes him vulnerable to kiting and being caught out of position. Players must be mindful of their positioning and engage fights wisely to avoid being easily taken down.

Nautilus' past in the game has seen him rise to prominence as a top-tier tank and crowd control champion. His ability to initiate fights and lock down enemies has made him a staple pick in competitive play. Nautilus has also received several balance changes and updates over the years to ensure he remains a viable and balanced champion in the game.

On this page, you can find information and videos about all of Nautilus' appearances, including the
skin. Whether you're a fan of his classic look or prefer the menacing appearance of the
skin, Nautilus offers a unique and exciting gameplay experience. Dive into the depths with Nautilus and unleash his devastating abilities to dominate the battlefield.

Nautilus (Shan Hai Scrolls Nautilus)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: January 8, 2021

Nautilus, the Titan of the Depths, has emerged from the depths of the ocean once again, but this time in a mesmerizing new skin called

. This skin takes inspiration from the ancient Chinese folklore and brings a whole new level of mystique and grandeur to the champion.

With its release on January 8, 2021,

has quickly become a fan-favorite skin among League of Legends players. Priced at 1350 RP, this skin offers a visually stunning and immersive experience for those who choose to wield the power of the ocean depths.

The Story of
The

skin draws its inspiration from the mythical Shan Hai Scrolls, a collection of ancient Chinese texts that depict a vast and mysterious world filled with mythical creatures and legendary heroes. In this skin, Nautilus becomes a guardian of the Shan Hai Scrolls, donning an armor adorned with intricate patterns and symbols.

The skin features a color palette dominated by deep blues and vibrant golds, representing the depths of the ocean and the treasures hidden within. Nautilus himself is transformed into a majestic figure, with his armor exuding an aura of power and ancient wisdom.

One of the most striking aspects of the

skin is the attention to detail. From the intricate patterns on his armor to the flowing water effects that surround him, every aspect of this skin has been meticulously crafted to create a visually stunning experience.

Additionally, the skin introduces new visual and sound effects to Nautilus's abilities. His anchor, instead of the usual rusty chain, now appears as a mystical artifact, pulsating with energy. The sound effects have also been modified to match the theme, immersing players in the world of the Shan Hai Scrolls.

Nautilus: The Titan of the Depths

Nautilus, the champion behind the

skin, is a powerful tank and crowd control specialist in League of Legends. He is known for his immense durability and ability to initiate team fights with his devastating crowd control abilities.

Once a sailor lost at sea, Nautilus was dragged down into the depths by a massive anchor. Over time, he became one with the ocean, transforming into a hulking titan. Now, he roams the depths, seeking to protect the ocean and its creatures from any who would harm them.

In the game, Nautilus excels at engaging enemies and disrupting their plans. His Q ability, Dredge Line, allows him to hook onto enemies and pull himself towards them, initiating fights or catching out-of-position enemies. His W ability, Titan's Wrath, grants him a shield and enhances his basic attacks, making him a formidable force in close combat.

Nautilus's E ability, Riptide, creates a wave that damages and slows enemies, further adding to his crowd control capabilities. Finally, his ultimate ability, Depth Charge, sends out a massive anchor that knocks up enemies in its path and stuns the target, allowing his team to follow up with devastating damage.

While Nautilus is a formidable tank and initiator, he does have some weaknesses. His lack of mobility makes him vulnerable to champions with high mobility or those who can kite him effectively. Additionally, his abilities have relatively long cooldowns, so timing and decision-making are crucial when playing Nautilus.

Despite his weaknesses, Nautilus has found a solid place in the game as a reliable tank and crowd control specialist. His ability to lock down key targets and soak up damage for his team makes him a valuable asset in team fights and objective control.

Explore Nautilus's Appearances

If you want to learn more about Nautilus and his various appearances in League of Legends, you can find detailed information and videos on our dedicated page. From his classic appearance to his other skins like
and

, you can discover the full range of Nautilus's visual transformations and choose the one that suits your playstyle the best.

Whether you prefer the ancient mystique of
or the futuristic vibes of
, Nautilus offers a diverse range of appearances that cater to different tastes and preferences. Dive into the world of Nautilus and unleash the power of the ocean depths!

Nautilus (Worldbreaker Nautilus)

RP Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: March 2, 2017

Worldbreaker Nautilus is a fearsome skin that brings a new level of power and intimidation to the depths of the ocean. With its unique design and thematic elements, this skin transforms Nautilus into a formidable force that strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies.

As a Worldbreaker skin, Nautilus embodies the destructive force of nature, channeling the power of earthquakes and cataclysmic events. The skin features a dark and menacing color scheme, with deep blues and purples that evoke the depths of the ocean. Nautilus himself is adorned with sharp, jagged armor, reminiscent of shattered earth and tectonic plates.

The most striking aspect of Worldbreaker Nautilus is his massive anchor, which has been transformed into a devastating weapon. The anchor is now encrusted with rocks and debris, giving it a weighty and destructive appearance. When Nautilus uses his abilities, the anchor unleashes powerful shockwaves and seismic energy, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake.

One of the standout features of this skin is the unique recall animation. When Nautilus recalls, he summons a massive whirlpool that engulfs him, pulling him into the depths of the ocean. This animation perfectly captures the theme of the skin and adds an extra layer of immersion to the gameplay experience.

Now, let's delve into the story of Nautilus and how he came to possess the Worldbreaker skin. Nautilus was once a sailor named Kled, who sailed the seas in search of adventure and treasure. However, during one fateful voyage, his ship was caught in a violent storm and capsized.

As Kled sank into the depths, he was consumed by darkness and despair. But instead of meeting his demise, he was transformed into a hulking behemoth, a creature of the deep. Nautilus emerged from the wreckage, his body encased in a suit of armor forged from the remnants of his ship.

Now, Nautilus roams the ocean depths, seeking vengeance on those who wronged him and protecting the seas from any who would dare to disturb its tranquility. With the Worldbreaker skin, Nautilus harnesses the power of the earth itself, becoming an unstoppable force of destruction.

In terms of gameplay, Nautilus is a tanky support champion known for his crowd control abilities and ability to initiate team fights. His passive ability, Staggering Blow, allows him to root enemies with his basic attacks, while his Q ability, Dredge Line, allows him to hook and pull enemies towards him.

Nautilus also has a powerful shield ability, Titan's Wrath, which absorbs damage and enhances his basic attacks. His ultimate ability, Depth Charge, sends out a massive shockwave that knocks up enemies and damages them, making it a devastating tool for engaging in team fights.

However, Nautilus does have some weaknesses. He is relatively slow and lacks mobility, making him vulnerable to champions with high mobility or long-range poke. Additionally, his abilities have long cooldowns, so timing and positioning are crucial for maximizing his impact in fights.

Despite his weaknesses, Nautilus is a popular pick in both professional and casual play due to his strong crowd control and tankiness. His ability to initiate fights and lock down key targets makes him a valuable asset to any team composition.

If you want to learn more about Nautilus and his various appearances in the game, you can find information and videos on the official League of Legends website. Whether you prefer the Worldbreaker Nautilus skin or one of his other appearances, Nautilus is a champion that brings a unique and powerful presence to the game.

Nautilus (Default)

Cost: N/A

Release Date: N/A

Nautilus, the Titan of the Depths, is a formidable champion in the popular online game League of Legends. As one of the original champions released in the game, Nautilus has become a fan favorite with his imposing presence and unique abilities. In this article, we will delve into the story behind Nautilus's default skin and explore all the intricate details of this iconic costume.

The Story Behind Nautilus's Default Skin

Nautilus's default skin represents his original appearance when he was first introduced to the League of Legends universe. Clad in a massive, rusted diving suit, Nautilus embodies the essence of a deep-sea diver who has been forever transformed by the unforgiving depths of the ocean. The suit itself is a testament to Nautilus's resilience and determination, as it has withstood the test of time and countless battles.

The diving suit is adorned with various details that add to Nautilus's intimidating presence. Thick, metal plates cover his body, providing him with protection against his enemies. Chains and anchors are intricately woven into the suit, symbolizing Nautilus's ability to control and manipulate the very forces of the ocean. The suit's helmet features a small window, allowing glimpses of Nautilus's glowing eyes, which burn with an otherworldly intensity.

The color scheme of Nautilus's default skin further enhances his aquatic theme. Shades of deep blue and dark gray dominate the suit, mirroring the depths of the ocean from which he emerged. The rusted and weathered appearance of the suit adds a touch of realism, showcasing the toll that Nautilus's underwater existence has taken on his armor.

Overall, Nautilus's default skin perfectly captures the essence of this mighty champion. It showcases his connection to the ocean depths and his unwavering determination to protect the innocent and punish the guilty. Whether you're a fan of his lore or simply appreciate his imposing presence on the battlefield, Nautilus's default skin is a testament to his enduring popularity.

The Story of Nautilus

Nautilus's story within the League of Legends universe is one of tragedy and redemption. Once a sailor named Kled, he was lost at sea during a violent storm. As his ship sank into the depths, Kled made a desperate pact with a mysterious entity known as the Titan of the Depths. In exchange for his life, Kled would become the vessel for the Titan's power, forever bound to the ocean's depths.

Emerging from the wreckage of his ship, Kled was reborn as Nautilus, a hulking behemoth with the strength to crush his enemies and the ability to manipulate water and control the tides. However, this newfound power came at a great cost. Nautilus was forever separated from his former life, condemned to wander the ocean depths as a solitary guardian.

In the game, Nautilus is classified as a tank and excels at initiating team fights and soaking up damage for his allies. His abilities, such as Dredge Line and Depth Charge, allow him to engage enemies from a distance and disrupt their positioning. Nautilus's passive ability, Staggering Blow, also provides him with crowd control, making him a formidable force in both solo and team play.

Despite his immense strength, Nautilus does have weaknesses. His lack of mobility can make him vulnerable to champions with high burst damage or those who can kite him effectively. Additionally, Nautilus relies heavily on his abilities to engage and control fights, making him susceptible to crowd control and ability interrupts.

In the League of Legends community, Nautilus has become a beloved champion due to his unique design and playstyle. His imposing presence and powerful abilities make him a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. Whether you're a fan of his lore or simply enjoy playing as a tanky initiator, Nautilus offers a satisfying and impactful gameplay experience.

To learn more about Nautilus and explore his various skins and appearances, you can visit the official League of Legends website or check out the numerous videos and guides available online. Whether you choose to don his default skin or one of his many alternate appearances, Nautilus is sure to make a splash in your League of Legends experience.

Nautilus (Cosmic Paladin Nautilus)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: August 27, 2020

Nautilus, the Titan of the Depths, has always been a formidable force on the Rift. With his massive anchor and imposing presence, he strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies. However, with the release of the Cosmic Paladin Nautilus skin, he takes on a whole new celestial form, embodying the power of the cosmos.

The Cosmic Paladin Nautilus skin is a visually stunning addition to Nautilus' repertoire. Clad in shimmering armor adorned with constellations and galaxies, he radiates an otherworldly aura. His anchor is transformed into a celestial weapon, crackling with cosmic energy. With each swing, the stars themselves seem to align, leaving a trail of stardust in his wake.

But the beauty of the Cosmic Paladin Nautilus skin goes beyond its visual appeal. It also comes with new spell effects that perfectly complement its cosmic theme. Nautilus' abilities are imbued with the power of the stars, creating mesmerizing visual displays. His Q ability, Dredge Line, sends out a cosmic tether that pulls enemies towards him, leaving behind a trail of stardust. His W ability, Titan's Wrath, envelops him in a celestial shield, shimmering with cosmic energy. And his ultimate ability, Depth Charge, unleashes a cosmic explosion upon impact, leaving enemies in awe of his celestial might.

Now, let's delve into the lore of Nautilus and how he came to possess the Cosmic Paladin Nautilus skin. Nautilus was once a sailor, exploring the treacherous seas in search of adventure. However, his life took a tragic turn when he encountered the monstrous sea creature known as the Kraken. In a desperate battle, Nautilus managed to defeat the Kraken but was dragged down into the depths of the ocean in the process.

For years, Nautilus remained trapped in the darkness, his body slowly transforming into a hulking, armored figure. He became a guardian of the deep, seeking redemption for his past and vowing to protect the seas from any threat that may arise. It was during his solitary journey through the depths that he encountered a celestial being known as Aurelion Sol, the Star Forger.

Aurelion Sol recognized Nautilus' unwavering determination and saw the potential within him. He bestowed upon Nautilus the power of the cosmos, transforming him into the Cosmic Paladin Nautilus. With his newfound celestial abilities, Nautilus emerged from the depths, ready to fulfill his duty as a guardian of the seas and the stars.

In the world of League of Legends, Nautilus is known for his tankiness and crowd control abilities. As a tank, he excels at soaking up damage and initiating team fights. His passive ability, Staggering Blow, allows him to root enemies with his basic attacks, making it difficult for them to escape. His Q ability, Dredge Line, is a long-range skillshot that can hook enemies and pull Nautilus towards them, setting up opportunities for his team to engage. His W ability, Titan's Wrath, grants him a shield that absorbs damage and enhances his basic attacks. His E ability, Riptide, unleashes a wave that damages and slows enemies in a cone in front of him. And finally, his ultimate ability, Depth Charge, sends out a massive anchor that knocks up enemies in its path and knocks up the primary target, allowing his team to follow up with devastating crowd control.

Nautilus' strengths lie in his ability to initiate team fights and lock down priority targets. With his crowd control abilities, he can single-handedly disrupt the enemy team's positioning and create opportunities for his allies to follow up. His tankiness also allows him to soak up damage and protect his carries in the midst of battle.

However, Nautilus does have some weaknesses. His lack of mobility makes him susceptible to kiting and being outmaneuvered by more agile champions. Additionally, his crowd control abilities have long cooldowns, so timing and positioning are crucial for him to be effective in team fights. Finally, Nautilus relies heavily on his team to follow up on his engages, so coordination and communication are key when playing him.

Overall, Nautilus is a powerful and iconic champion in the world of League of Legends. With his Cosmic Paladin Nautilus skin, he takes on a whole new celestial form, embodying the beauty and power of the cosmos. Whether you're a fan of his lore, his gameplay, or simply his stunning visual design, the Cosmic Paladin Nautilus skin is a must-have for any Nautilus enthusiast.

For more information about Nautilus and his various appearances, including the Cosmic Paladin Nautilus skin, be sure to visit our page dedicated to the Titan of the Depths. Watch videos showcasing his abilities and skins, and dive into the rich lore that surrounds this iconic champion.

Nautilus (Fright Night Nautilus)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: October 29, 2012

Nautilus, the Titan of the Depths, is a fearsome champion in the popular online game League of Legends. With his massive anchor and imposing presence, he strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies. However, there is one skin that takes his terrifying nature to a whole new level - Fright Night Nautilus.

Released on October 29, 2012, Fright Night Nautilus is a skin that perfectly captures the essence of Halloween. This skin transforms Nautilus into a nightmarish creature of the deep, ready to haunt the Rift and strike fear into the hearts of his opponents. Let's delve into the details of this spine-chilling skin.

Fright Night Nautilus features a complete visual overhaul, giving Nautilus a truly terrifying appearance. His armor is adorned with eerie glowing green accents, reminiscent of a ghostly apparition. The anchor he wields is transformed into a wicked scythe, perfect for reaping souls. The most striking feature of this skin is Nautilus' head, which is now a menacing jack-o'-lantern with glowing eyes and a sinister grin. This skin truly embodies the spirit of Halloween and is a must-have for any Nautilus player looking to strike fear into their enemies.

But what about Nautilus himself? Who is this fearsome champion and what is his story in the world of League of Legends?

Nautilus was once a sailor, exploring the vast oceans of Runeterra. However, his life took a tragic turn when he encountered a mysterious and powerful creature from the depths. This creature cursed Nautilus, transforming him into a hulking behemoth and binding him to the ocean's depths for eternity. Now, Nautilus roams the seas as a vengeful spirit, seeking to bring justice to those who would harm the natural world.

In the game, Nautilus is a tanky support champion with a focus on crowd control and disruption. His abilities allow him to engage enemies, lock them down with his anchor, and protect his allies with his massive shield. Nautilus' strengths lie in his ability to initiate team fights and peel for his carries, making him a valuable asset in any team composition.

However, Nautilus does have his weaknesses. His lack of mobility makes him vulnerable to champions with high burst damage or those who can kite him effectively. Additionally, his reliance on crowd control means that he can struggle against champions with strong crowd control reduction or immunity. Nautilus players must be mindful of these weaknesses and play strategically to maximize their impact in the game.

Nautilus has become a staple pick in professional play, known for his ability to engage and lock down priority targets. His crowd control and tankiness make him a valuable asset in team fights, and his presence alone can often dictate the outcome of a game. Whether played in the top lane, jungle, or support role, Nautilus is a force to be reckoned with.

If you're interested in learning more about Nautilus and his various appearances in the game, you can find information and videos on his champion page. From his classic appearance to his terrifying Fright Night skin, Nautilus offers a unique and enjoyable gameplay experience for those who dare to brave the depths.

So, whether you're looking to strike fear into your enemies with Fright Night Nautilus or explore the depths of the ocean with his classic appearance, Nautilus is a champion that should not be overlooked. Dive into the world of League of Legends and discover the power of the Titan of the Depths.
